subject: Critical Thinking
title: System 1 vs. System 2: The Two Minds
description: A fast breakdown of System 1 vs. System 2: The Two Minds for builders.

hook.text: You have two thinking systems. One is fast and automatic. The other is slow and lazy. Guess which wins.

buildup.text: System 1: instant, intuitive, effortless. It catches a ball, reads a face, and jumps to conclusions.

discovery.text: System 2: deliberate, logical, effortful. It does math, weighs evidence, and checks System 1's work.

twist.text: System 2 is lazy. It usually accepts System 1's snap judgments without checking. That's where biases thrive.

climax.text: Most biases are System 1 errors that System 2 didn't bother to catch.

punchline.text: Thinking slow is hard. That's why we rarely do it.

quiz.question: Why do most cognitive biases occur?
options: System 2 lazily accepts System 1's snap judgments
